result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert K Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 165 sentence credit.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with the victim (S. B.) listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15FO433 is dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert K Stein

records.addlTxt:
Filed by Court Reporter, Linda Coleman, From Plea and Sentencing Hearing Held on 01/13/16.
Transcript filed in 15CF982.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert K Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 4.
Counts 1, 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  2 Years.
Initial Confinement:  18 Months.
Extended Supervision:  6 Months.
165 Days Credit.
Concurrent to anyother sentence.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (S.B.) listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Costs:243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Defendant Robert K Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Eugene E. Detert.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  City of Waukesha Police Officer Condon sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Suha.  Cross examination by Attorney Detert.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Detert moves to dismiss count 1 and makes further closing statements.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
